[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 23]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Hand - Time to Win!**

Okay, so I'm in Round 3, Ante 2/8. The goal is 1600 chips, and I'm currently at 1534. I've only got three hands left to reach that, but I need a measly 66 chips to win. No discards available, thanks to the Boss effect. I've got a decent hand, and some potent Jokers: Mail-In Rebate, Ride the Bus, Red Card, and Blue Joker. The Blue Joker alone is the key here; it gives me a solid chip boost per card in the deck, which is currently at +78.

My hand consists of the 2 of Spades, Queen of Hearts, 9 of Hearts, Ace of Clubs, Jack of Clubs, 5 of Clubs, 8 of Diamonds, and 7 of Diamonds. A simple High Card is my best bet right now, as it offers a 5-chip base and 1 multiplier. I see immediately that the Blue Joker, combined with *any* scoring card, will easily give me the chips I need.

Playing just the 2 of Spades will do the trick: I'll score (5 base + 2 card + 78 Blue Joker) chips, giving me a total of 85 chips. Then, with a 12 multiplier from Mail-In Rebate, Ride the Bus, and base, that turns into a score of 1020! More than enough.

Now, I'm thinking about "Ride the Bus." I'll get an extra multiplier if I play consecutive hands *without* scoring face cards. I've got to avoid playing the Queen of Hearts or the Jack of Clubs in this round, if I want to keep that multiplier climbing. Right now, I can play the 2 of Spades and meet the minimum with a base High Card. But, let's look for a multi-card solution, where I *don't* score a face card.

Okay. Playing the 2 of Spades, 9 of Hearts, Ace of Clubs, 5 of Clubs, and 8 of Diamonds won't score a face card and yields a larger hand score. The cards add 11 chips (2 + 9 + 5 + 8 + 0), base of 5 plus 78 (Blue Joker) is a score of 94 chips. The math is simple, (5 + 11 + 78) * 12 = 1128 chips. Since that also secures the win, I'll go with the single card to save time.

Let's stick with the simplest option, which is the 2 of Spades. That's a clean "High Card" hand, and 1020 chips is a sure win.

I'm playing the 2 of Spades in position 1. And the JSON format is checked. I have decided to "play" the "high card" consisting of the card in position 1, estimated to provide me with a score of 1020 chips.



Command: play 1 high card 1020

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
